body_html:
I see. In the original issue the client was calling tf.contrib.slim.dataset.Dataset() which doesn't appear to have an option to thoroughly randomize its inputs.

I'm pretty new to TF, so I may be missing lots of things here :)
body_text:
I see. In the original issue the client was calling tf.contrib.slim.dataset.Dataset() which doesn't appear to have an option to thoroughly randomize its inputs.
I'm pretty new to TF, so I may be missing lots of things here :)
body:
I see. In the [original issue](https://github.com/google/seq2seq/issues/262) the client was calling [tf.contrib.slim.dataset.Dataset()](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/slim/python/slim/data/dataset.py#L38) which doesn't appear to have an option to thoroughly randomize its inputs.

I'm pretty new to TF, so I may be missing lots of things here :)
